connector.description: Manage keys stored in AWS KMS instances.

camel.sink.endpoint.operation.name: camel.sink.endpoint.operation
camel.sink.endpoint.operation.description: The operation to perform One of: [listKeys] [createKey] [disableKey] [scheduleKeyDeletion] [describeKey] [enableKey]

camel.sink.endpoint.overrideEndpoint.name: camel.sink.endpoint.overrideEndpoint
camel.sink.endpoint.overrideEndpoint.description: Set the need for overriding the endpoint. This option needs to be used in combination with the uriEndpointOverride option

camel.sink.endpoint.pojoRequest.name: camel.sink.endpoint.pojoRequest
camel.sink.endpoint.pojoRequest.description: If we want to use a POJO request as body or not

camel.sink.endpoint.region.name: camel.sink.endpoint.region
camel.sink.endpoint.region.description: The region in which EKS client needs to work. When using this parameter, the configuration will expect the lowercase name of the region (for example, ap-east-1) You'll need to use the name Region.EU_WEST_1.id() One of: [ap-south-2] [ap-south-1] [eu-south-1] [eu-south-2] [us-gov-east-1] [me-central-1] [il-central-1] [ca-central-1] [eu-central-1] [us-iso-west-1] [eu-central-2] [us-west-1] [us-west-2] [af-south-1] [eu-north-1] [eu-west-3] [eu-west-2] [eu-west-1] [ap-northeast-3] [ap-northeast-2] [ap-northeast-1] [me-south-1] [sa-east-1] [ap-east-1] [cn-north-1] [us-gov-west-1] [ap-southeast-1] [ap-southeast-2] [us-iso-east-1] [ap-southeast-3] [ap-southeast-4] [us-east-1] [us-east-2] [cn-northwest-1] [us-isob-east-1] [aws-global] [aws-cn-global] [aws-us-gov-global] [aws-iso-global] [aws-iso-b-global]

camel.sink.endpoint.uriEndpointOverride.name: camel.sink.endpoint.uriEndpointOverride
camel.sink.endpoint.uriEndpointOverride.description: Set the overriding uri endpoint. This option needs to be used in combination with overrideEndpoint option

camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.name: camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer
camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

camel.sink.endpoint.kmsClient.name: camel.sink.endpoint.kmsClient
camel.sink.endpoint.kmsClient.description: To use an existing configured AWS KMS client

camel.sink.endpoint.proxyHost.name: camel.sink.endpoint.proxyHost
camel.sink.endpoint.proxyHost.description: To define a proxy host when instantiating the KMS client

camel.sink.endpoint.proxyPort.name: camel.sink.endpoint.proxyPort
camel.sink.endpoint.proxyPort.description: To define a proxy port when instantiating the KMS client

camel.sink.endpoint.proxyProtocol.name: camel.sink.endpoint.proxyProtocol
camel.sink.endpoint.proxyProtocol.description: To define a proxy protocol when instantiating the KMS client One of: [HTTP] [HTTPS]

camel.sink.endpoint.profileCredentialsNa.name: camel.sink.endpoint.profileCredentialsName
camel.sink.endpoint.profileCredentialsNa.description: If using a profile credentials provider, this parameter will set the profile name

camel.sink.endpoint.sessionToken.name: camel.sink.endpoint.sessionToken
camel.sink.endpoint.sessionToken.description: Amazon AWS Session Token used when the user needs to assume an IAM role

camel.sink.endpoint.trustAllCertificates.name: camel.sink.endpoint.trustAllCertificates
camel.sink.endpoint.trustAllCertificates.description: If we want to trust all certificates in case of overriding the endpoint

camel.sink.endpoint.useDefaultCredential.name: camel.sink.endpoint.useDefaultCredentialsProvider
camel.sink.endpoint.useDefaultCredential.description: Set whether the KMS client should expect to load credentials through a default credentials provider or to expect static credentials to be passed in.

camel.sink.endpoint.useProfileCredential.name: camel.sink.endpoint.useProfileCredentialsProvider
camel.sink.endpoint.useProfileCredential.description: Set whether the KMS client should expect to load credentials through a profile credentials provider.

camel.sink.endpoint.useSessionCredential.name: camel.sink.endpoint.useSessionCredentials
camel.sink.endpoint.useSessionCredential.description: Set whether the KMS client should expect to use Session Credentials. This is useful in a situation in which the user needs to assume a IAM role for doing operations in KMS.

camel.component.aws2-kms.lazyStartProduc.name: camel.component.aws2-kms.lazyStartProducer
camel.component.aws2-kms.lazyStartProduc.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

camel.component.aws2-kms.operation.name: camel.component.aws2-kms.operation
camel.component.aws2-kms.operation.description: The operation to perform One of: [listKeys] [createKey] [disableKey] [scheduleKeyDeletion] [describeKey] [enableKey]

camel.component.aws2-kms.overrideEndpoin.name: camel.component.aws2-kms.overrideEndpoint
camel.component.aws2-kms.overrideEndpoin.description: Set the need for overriding the endpoint. This option needs to be used in combination with the uriEndpointOverride option

camel.component.aws2-kms.pojoRequest.name: camel.component.aws2-kms.pojoRequest
camel.component.aws2-kms.pojoRequest.description: If we want to use a POJO request as body or not

camel.component.aws2-kms.region.name: camel.component.aws2-kms.region
camel.component.aws2-kms.region.description: The region in which EKS client needs to work. When using this parameter, the configuration will expect the lowercase name of the region (for example, ap-east-1) You'll need to use the name Region.EU_WEST_1.id() One of: [ap-south-2] [ap-south-1] [eu-south-1] [eu-south-2] [us-gov-east-1] [me-central-1] [il-central-1] [ca-central-1] [eu-central-1] [us-iso-west-1] [eu-central-2] [us-west-1] [us-west-2] [af-south-1] [eu-north-1] [eu-west-3] [eu-west-2] [eu-west-1] [ap-northeast-3] [ap-northeast-2] [ap-northeast-1] [me-south-1] [sa-east-1] [ap-east-1] [cn-north-1] [us-gov-west-1] [ap-southeast-1] [ap-southeast-2] [us-iso-east-1] [ap-southeast-3] [ap-southeast-4] [us-east-1] [us-east-2] [cn-northwest-1] [us-isob-east-1] [aws-global] [aws-cn-global] [aws-us-gov-global] [aws-iso-global] [aws-iso-b-global]

camel.component.aws2-kms.uriEndpointOver.name: camel.component.aws2-kms.uriEndpointOverride
camel.component.aws2-kms.uriEndpointOver.description: Set the overriding uri endpoint. This option needs to be used in combination with overrideEndpoint option

camel.component.aws2-kms.autowiredEnable.name: camel.component.aws2-kms.autowiredEnabled
camel.component.aws2-kms.autowiredEnable.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.

camel.component.aws2-kms.kmsClient.name: camel.component.aws2-kms.kmsClient
camel.component.aws2-kms.kmsClient.description: To use an existing configured AWS KMS client

camel.component.aws2-kms.proxyHost.name: camel.component.aws2-kms.proxyHost
camel.component.aws2-kms.proxyHost.description: To define a proxy host when instantiating the KMS client

camel.component.aws2-kms.proxyPort.name: camel.component.aws2-kms.proxyPort
camel.component.aws2-kms.proxyPort.description: To define a proxy port when instantiating the KMS client

camel.component.aws2-kms.proxyProtocol.name: camel.component.aws2-kms.proxyProtocol
camel.component.aws2-kms.proxyProtocol.description: To define a proxy protocol when instantiating the KMS client One of: [HTTP] [HTTPS]

camel.component.aws2-kms.profileCredenti.name: camel.component.aws2-kms.profileCredentialsName
camel.component.aws2-kms.profileCredenti.description: If using a profile credentials provider, this parameter will set the profile name

camel.component.aws2-kms.sessionToken.name: camel.component.aws2-kms.sessionToken
camel.component.aws2-kms.sessionToken.description: Amazon AWS Session Token used when the user needs to assume an IAM role

camel.component.aws2-kms.trustAllCertifi.name: camel.component.aws2-kms.trustAllCertificates
camel.component.aws2-kms.trustAllCertifi.description: If we want to trust all certificates in case of overriding the endpoint

camel.component.aws2-kms.useDefaultCrede.name: camel.component.aws2-kms.useDefaultCredentialsProvider
camel.component.aws2-kms.useDefaultCrede.description: Set whether the KMS client should expect to load credentials through a default credentials provider or to expect static credentials to be passed in.

camel.component.aws2-kms.useProfileCrede.name: camel.component.aws2-kms.useProfileCredentialsProvider
camel.component.aws2-kms.useProfileCrede.description: Set whether the KMS client should expect to load credentials through a profile credentials provider.

camel.component.aws2-kms.useSessionCrede.name: camel.component.aws2-kms.useSessionCredentials
camel.component.aws2-kms.useSessionCrede.description: Set whether the KMS client should expect to use Session Credentials. This is useful in a situation in which the user needs to assume a IAM role for doing operations in KMS.
